metadata.title: CVE-2020-36766 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.8.6.drivers/media/cec/core/cec-api.c leaks one byte of kernel memory onspecific hardware to unprivileged users, because of directly assigninglog_addrs with a hole in the struct.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36766` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-121.123
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-121.123
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-121.123
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-121.123
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-121.123
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-51.56~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-51.56~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-51.56~18.04.1

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-121.123').
